definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To divide into quarters; to divide by four .
( transitive ) To provide housing for military personnel or other equipment.
examples: Quarter the horses in the third stable.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To lodge ; to have a temporary residence.
( transitive , historical ) To execute (someone) by tying each limb to a different animal (such as a horse ) and driving them in different directions .
( heraldry ) To display different coats of arms in the quarters of a shield.
( transitive ) To range to and fro over an area; to move from point to point.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To divide into quarters; to divide by four .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To provide housing for military personnel or other equipment.
( intransitive ) To lodge ; to have a temporary residence.
( transitive , historical ) To execute (someone) by tying each limb to a different animal (such as a horse ) and driving them in different directions .
( heraldry ) To display different coats of arms in the quarters of a shield.
( transitive ) To range to and fro over an area; to move from point to point.

definitions.definition: To drive a carriage so as to prevent the wheels from going into the ruts, or so that a rut shall be between the wheels.

main_definition: ( obsolete ) To drive a carriage so as to prevent the wheels from going into the ruts, or so that a rut shall be between the wheels.
